TopicTitle: "Eve: Order Zero" -- a KSP Graphic Novel (POSTLUDE COMPLETE...bet you didn't see THAT coming.)

I'll revert from almost anything, Gamer--but once it's in the comic I can't go back!

> Judging from past experience of Tedus...

Sure, but that was a Gliido. The Dipperkraft is an entirely different kind of ship altogether...

Oh no, the Dipperkraft is exploding! Here is an xkcd comic to explain my worries. [https://xkcd.com/1029/](https://xkcd.com/1029/) 

Oh no, more worries! This is my 666th post! (Actually, my 666th post being afraid of something makes sense.) 

EDIT: And now I have 333 rep to go along with 666 posts. I have exactly half the rep of my post count.

What an evil cliffy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) What will happen to our daring duo? Awesome chapter Kuzzter ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Can't wait for the behind the scenes stuff. Your craft are an inspiration for my game.

My first Duna window has a Humblebee inspired plane that will stay on station for science and surveys. It is definitely the flagship mission.

My initial Eve exploration will rely on a nuclear powered dipper for high atmospheric science. I'm saving low atmo science for another craft as the dV requirements for return from angels 20 (low atmo boundary) were crazy if I allowed the craft to decelerate to 1.5 km/s for thermal profile. Nukes are still more efficient than spikes that high, but the tyranny of the rocket equation was starting to show up and without the first mission, there were too many unknowns about performance. I may punt and design a rocket plane for low science and a conventional lifter for crew/sample return. I'm dieing to see your craft's stats.

Gha! How do you add more rep in mobile view?

You know, the worst part about this cliffhanger is that tomorrow is Friday so the forum will be down most of the day for maintenance....

> 
> You know, the worst part about this cliffhanger is that tomorrow is Friday so the forum will be down most of the day for maintenance....

 Was not going to post more until later in the day anyway. Hopefully the edges of everyones' seats will be comfortable enough until then.

> 
> Thank you! But don't base your mission on the stats for the Dipperkraft, unless you are also trying to write an adventure with lots of explosions and cliffhangers ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Obviously. You craft can still make a good marker of not enough dV though. I must admit, when I started my design, I assumed you would keep your craft to high atmo. I was sure nothing that small could have enough dV to get back out from low atmo.

Of course, now I have an even crazier idea for a reusable staged Eve launch system. Need to see how much dV I can eek out of two stages.

All right, the forum still seems to be up, you can have two more...
